Package com.iontrading.mkv.messagequeue

Class MkvMQConf

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iontrading.mkv.messagequeue.MkvMQConf
  • @Keep
@KeepPublicClassMemberNames
public class MkvMQConf
extends Object
    A configuration class for message queues.

    This class contains a set of properties which can be passed for customizing message queues created through the create method.

    See Also:
    MkvMQManager, MkvMQ

      • isExpireOnUnsubscribe

        public boolean isExpireOnUnsubscribe()
        Retrieves the ExpireOnUnsubscribe attribute.
        Returns:
        ExpireOnUnsubscribe value.

      • setExpireOnUnsubscribe

        public void setExpireOnUnsubscribe​(boolean expireOnUnsubscribe)
        Sets the ExpireOnUnsubscribe attribute.

        If ExpireOnUnsubscribe is true the queue resources will be released when a consumer closes its subscription; this is the default behavior if ExpireOnUnsubscribe is not explicitly set.

        Parameters:
        expireOnUnsubscribe - true if the MessageQueue must be automatically destroyed when the downstream subscriber unsubscribe from it or dies.

      • setEnforcePartialSupplySupportOnSubscriber

        public void setEnforcePartialSupplySupportOnSubscriber​(boolean enforcePartialSupplySupportOnSubscriber)
        Declares that the Message Queue Publisher will generate partial supplies. As such, the API enforces that the Subscriber component can deal with partial supplies as well. The following compatibility matrix applies:
        • Case 1 - default, backward compatibility
          EnforcePartialSupplySupportOnSubscriber = false | default
          Subscriber API version = ANY
          Expected result: the Message Queue remains alive and data is flowing
        • Case 2 - Partial supplies with Subscriber supporting them
          EnforcePartialSupplySupportOnSubscriber = true
          Subscriber API version = 160 or higher
          Expected result: the Message Queue remains alive and data is flowing
        • Case 3 - Mismatch
          EnforcePartialSupplySupportOnSubscriber = true
          Subscriber API version = lower than 160
          Expected result: the Message Queue is forcibly closed by the Publisher API and an error System Message is sent to the Platform.
        The flag is false by default.
        Parameters:
        enforcePartialSupplySupportOnSubscriber - set to true if the Publisher intends to produce partial supplies on this Message Queue

      • getEnforcePartialSupplySupportOnSubscriber

        public boolean getEnforcePartialSupplySupportOnSubscriber()
        Return the partial supply flag on this MkvMQConf.

        the partial supply flag on this MkvMQConf.

      • getMaxSize

        public final int getMaxSize()
        Returns the MaxSize value.
        Returns:
        the MaxSize value.
        See Also:
        setMaxSize(int)

      • setMaxSize

        public final void setMaxSize​(int maxsize)
        Sets the MaxSize value.

        MaxSize represents the maximum number of elements that could be stored in the queue before being delivered.
        A value of 0 or less enables potentially unlimited queue size; this is the default behavior if MaxSize is not explicitly set.

        Parameters:
        maxsize - The new MaxSize value
        See Also:
        MkvMQ.put(com.iontrading.mkv.enums.MkvMQAction)

      • getSubscriber

        public final String getSubscriber()
        Returns the Subscriber value.
        Returns:
        the Subscriber value.
        See Also:
        setSubscriber(String)

      • setSubscriber

        public final void setSubscriber​(String subscriber)
        Sets the subscriber value.

        A message queue can be possibly bound to a certain component. Therefore, when this value is set, subscriptions and ack requests are accepted only if coming from the specified subscriber.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - the new Subscriber value

      • getTimeout

        public final int getTimeout()
        Returns the Timeout value.
        Returns:
        the Timeout value.
        See Also:
        setTimeout(int)

      • setTimeout

        public final void setTimeout​(int timeout)
        Sets the Timeout value in seconds.

        The Timeout value defines how long the message queue is to be kept active after it has been created. When the expiration time is reached the message queue is automatically destroyed.
        A value of 0 or less makes the message queue to never expire; this is the default behavior if Timeout is not explicitly set.
        Setting a timeout can be useful to automatically release queue resources when no longer needed; when publishing a message queue in response to a function call, it is useful to set up a non zero timeout in conjunction with the DisableTimeoutOnSubscribe attribute.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the new Timeout value
        See Also:
        setDisableTimeoutOnSubscribe(boolean)

      • getFlowSize

        public final int getFlowSize()
        Returns the FlowSize value.
        Returns:
        the FlowSize value.
        See Also:
        setFlowSize(int)

      • setFlowSize

        public final void setFlowSize​(int flowSize)
        Sets the FlowSize value.

        FlowSize represents the maximum number of elements that could be sent before requesting an ack.
        Reliable delivery of message queue updates is implemented by means of an acknowledgement protocol driven by the publisher side; after sending up to FlowSize messages, the publisher will request the subscriber to ack the sequence number for the latest in sequence queue update it received; if any gap is found, the publisher will send back missing updates; this synchronization mechanism can be explicitly activated at any time by invoking the flush method.
        Default FlowSize value is 256.

        Parameters:
        flowSize - The new FlowSize value
        See Also:
        MkvMQ.flush()

      • getDisableTimeoutOnSubscribe

        public boolean getDisableTimeoutOnSubscribe()
        Gets the DisableTimeoutOnSubscribe value.

        Returns:
        the DisableTimeoutOnSubscribe value

      • setDisableTimeoutOnSubscribe

        public void setDisableTimeoutOnSubscribe​(boolean disableTimeoutOnSubscribe)
        Sets the DisableTimeoutOnSubscribe flag.

        If DisableTimeoutOnSubscribe is set to true, timeout of queue is disarmed on the queue being subscribed; by setting this parameter to true, a component implementing a publish-on-demand protocol can use the timeout value as an actual timeout for the interval between queue creation and queue subscription.
        Default DisableTimeoutOnSubscribe value is false.

        Parameters:
        disableTimeoutOnSubscribe - The new DisableTimeoutOnSubscribe value
